intro: Pedicularis elwesii var. typica, commonly known as the Elwes' lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of red and purple, often blooming in late summer. It thrives in alpine environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
